column1: 1^Dīxit insapiens in corde suō: Nōn est Deus. Corruptī sunt
column2: et abōminābilēs factī sunt in studiīs suīs; nōn est quī faciat bonum
column3: nōn est usque ad ūnum.^The fool hath said in his heart: There is no God. They are corrupt
column4: and are become abominable in their pursuits; there is none that doth good

column1: 2^Dominus dē caelō prōspexit super fīliōs hominum
column3: aut requīrens Deum.^The Lord hath looked down from heaven upon the children of men
column4: to see if there be any that understand and seek God.

column2: simul inūtilēs factī sunt. Nōn est quī faciat bonum
column3: nōn est usque ad ūnum.^They are all gone aside
column4: they are become unprofitable together. There is none that doth good

column2: quī dēvorant plēbem meam sīcut ēscam pānis?^Shall not all they know that work iniquity
column3: who devour my people as the food of bread?

column2: ubi nōn erat timor.^They have not called upon the Lord; there have they trembled for fear

column1: 6^Quoniam Dominus in generātiōne jūstā est; consilium inopis confūdistis
column2: quoniam Dominus spēs ejus est.^For the Lord is in the just generation; you have confounded the counsel of the poor man
column3: but the Lord is his hope.

column1: 7^Quis dabit ex Sion salūtāre Isrāēl? Quum āverterit Dominus captīvitātem plēbis suae
column3: et laetābitur Isrāēl.^Who shall give out of Sion the salvation of Israel? When the Lord shall have turned away the captivity of his people
